benchmark_details.name: SycEval: Evaluating LLM Sycophancy
benchmark_details.overview: This study introduces a framework to evaluate sycophantic behavior in models like ChatGPT-4o, Claude-Sonnet, and Gemini-1.5-Pro across the AMPS (mathematics) and MedQuad (medical advice) datasets.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and benchmark sycophantic behavior in large language models to ensure reliability in high-stakes applications.

data.source: AMPS Mathematics dataset and MedQuad medical advice dataset.
data.annotation: Manually designed Mathematica scripts for AMPS; Medical questions collected from real-life patient inquiries for MedQuad.

methodology.calculation: Confidence intervals calculated using binomial proportions; differences analyzed via statistical testing.
methodology.interpretation: Sycophancy is interpreted in terms of agreement with user prompts versus factual correctness.
methodology.baseline_results: Gemini exhibited the highest sycophancy rate at 62.47%.
methodology.validation: Validated through both LLM evaluation and human response categorization.
